summary: A unique player home designed with storage and display in mind. It is located just outside of Riften on the main road. This house is compatible with Hearthfire Multiple Adoption Mod by TMPhoenix and supports 6 children.
descriptionHtml:
I found most homes in Skyrim to be lacking as far as display and storage are concerned. I wanted something functional (hence the original
name) and visually pleasing. I placed the home outside of Riften as I didn't want to mess around in the town.

The armoury has 10 mannequins with a weapon rack, plaque, and display for each. Numerous custom player storage containers are scattered throughout the home. The latest update comes packed with over a dozen new NPCS, including several master trainers. Please note that there are 3 secret rooms [one per floor] hidden throughout the house. See if you can find them all.

This mod was cleaned using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/25859/?]TES5edit[/url]

----------------
Instructions for moving your family in (changing homes)

1. Make sure you have [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29249/?]Hearthfire Multiple Adoption mod by TMPhoenix[/url] installed.
2. Go inside and cast Bless Home spell
3. Talk to either your spouse or kids, and tell them to move to the new home.

Hope this helps :)
----------------

I can't believe that my mod has been downloaded over 250 times. Thank you to everyone who has been willing to give a first time modders project a chance. I hope you enjoy using my mod as much as I enjoyed creating it. Thank you to AtomicNewt for being my top QC guy and fountain of support.

Huge thanks to those who came before me, and documented their journey. Your experience was invaluable.
[url=https://www.youtube.com/user/DARKF0X127]Darkfox127 YouTube Tutorials[/url]
[url=http://www.creationkit.com/Category:Tutorials]Creation Kit Wiki[/url]
[url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL1OWQesYwsW0iioeKx-SnA]Bethesda Game Studios Tutorials[/url]

A humongous thank you to the peeps below for creating these amazing resources/mods, and making them available to everyone.

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30601/?]Ingredients in a Jar by Blary[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/30599/?]Alchemy Clutter by Blary[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14136/?]PotionShelf Resource by Blary[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14135/?]BookSets Resource by Blary[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/14134/?]OpenBooks Resource - Blary[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17423/?]Paintings and Frames - Artisanix[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49620/?]Hobbiton House - Cadaha[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/16525/?]MODDER'S RESOURCE PACK - Oaristys & Tony67[/url]

author: MissConstrued

files.name: Nirnroot Manor - A Functional Home Core BSA without .ESP
Nirnroot Manor - A Functional Home .ESP update to version 1.0
files.changelogHtml:
Added Exterior to cell and located it outside of Riften (map marker will update automatically)
Uploaded .ESP update V1.0 so main package does not need to be downloaded again for those who have already downloaded
Fixed floating beams above the fountain
Added torches to exterior for nighttime illumination

files.name: Nirnroot Manor - A Functional Home .ESP v 0.1 No exterior
Nirnroot Manor - A Functional Home .ESP Upgrade to V1.1
files.changelogHtml:
Changes from 1.0 to 1.1

- Now Fully compatible with Hearthfire Multiple Adoption Mod by TMPhoenix
- House supports the maximum of 6 children
- Changed name from "The TARDIS" to "Nirnroot Manor" (now Lore Friendly)
- Removed pre-stocked cheat chests from smithing, alchemy and enchanting rooms
- Changed floor braziers to hanging braziers in library and master bedroom
- Removed static coin stack from treasury (was causing CTD)
- Replaced static gem chest with gem chest container in treasury
- Added flowers and chair markers to benches in Armoury
- Added mannequin to smithing room
- Fixed floating exterior, moved some trees
- Added chickens, and fixed AI so they don't wander off
- added fence around chickens to stop wolf attacks
- Added clutter and lights to hallways
- Replaced big Dibella statue, now you can't knock it over
- Fixed the critter landing markers so butterflies are actually landing on objects and not levitating
- Put a collision plane in front of the dishes in the pub to prevent them from flying everywhere

files.name: Nirnroot Manor - A Functional Home v1.2
files.fileName: Nirnroot Manor A Functional Home v1.2-57192-1-2.zip
files.changelogHtml:
Changes 1.1 - 1.2

- Fixed doors so follower can enter
- Nav meshed interior and exterior

Changes 1.2 - 1.2a

- None. Nexus kept sending the file back in for scanning every time it cleared, therefore it never became available for download for more than a couple minutes at a time. Uploading another version resolved the issue.

files.name: Nirnroot Manor 1.3
files.changelogHtml:
Changes from 1.2 to 1.3
- Added separate merchant to pub
- Removed merchant & speech training faction from Tovina (formerly Sonya)
- Added master Sneak trainer to Pub
- Added master Alchemy trainer to apothecary
- Added master Heavy/Light Armour, One-Hand, Two-Hand, and Archery trainers to Armoury
- Added master Smithing trainer to Smithing area
- Shrunk child beds to 85% in order for markers to work properly
- Added master Enchanter trainer
- Added master Conjuration and Destruction trainers
- Coffins in basement hidden room
- Added Chef, Servants (3)
- Added paintings (all uncredited pictures are copyright/licensing/royalty free) to hallways
